quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Book and Ring
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, high, knock. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This British band is best known for the 1975 world-famous hit, Sky High.
In the book The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, what two races do not like each other?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elves and dwarfs

questions.question: In the book The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, who sings a song to the willow tree that has trapped Merry and Pippin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Bombadil

questions.question: This singer and songwriter is best known for his hits, I Write The Songs, Mandy and Copacabana (At The Copa).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barry Manilow

questions.question: In the book The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, what character helps the four hobbits get on their way while they are still in the Shire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Farmer Maggot

questions.question: In the book The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring , who saves Frodo after he was stabbed by the wraith?
Who sang Lido Shuffle, a song featured in the 1976 album, Silk Degrees?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boz Scaggs

questions.question: About how old is Frodo when he leaves the Shire in the book The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring?
Her Knock Knock Whos There was released as a single (APPLE 26) on March 23, 1970.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Hopkin

questions.question: Who sang Something in the Air, which appeared on the soundtrack of the film The Strawberry Statement (1970)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thunderclap Newman

questions.question: What is rock singer and musician, Alice Coopers real name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vincent Furnier

questions.question: Terry Jacks and his wife Susan Pesklevits formed this pop musical group, popular in 1960s and early 70s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Poppy Family

questions.question: Does Frodo leave directly from Bag End when he takes the ring to Elrond?
This 1970s funk group had three singles, among which, Boogie Nights
Is there a character in the book The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, that is still able to see the person wearing the ring?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: America and Akeem
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, actor, cleo. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the movie Coming to America, Akeem and Semmi visit the United States of America to search for Akeems future bride. In which borough of New York City do they decide to begin their bridal search?

Lisa, one of the characters from the movie Coming to America, dated a young man by the name of Darryl Jenks (played by Eriq La Salle). Daryl was spoiled, rich and destined to inherit a fortune from his fathers business. What was the name of his fathers company?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Soul Glo

questions.question: What  pop band, formed in 1973 in San Francisco, California, sang  Whatcha Gonna Do?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pablo Cruise

questions.question: In Coming to America, Akeem and Semmi stop a hold-up man trying to rob Cleos restaurant.  What famous actor plays the robber?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Samuel L. Jackson

questions.question: In the comedy movie Coming to America, Akeem was the prince of what country?

In the comedy movie Coming to America, the cab driver that picks up Akeem and Semmi from the airport when they arrive in New York City was played by Jake Steinfeld, who had his own fitness show called Body by Jake back in the 1980s.

In the movie Coming to America, one of the first things Akeem did when he arrived in America was to get a haircut. When Akeem walked into the barber shop, Clarence the barber told him that he would be with him in a moment because he was already cutting someone elses hair. What famous Academy Award- winning actor portrayed the young man who was getting his hair cut when Akeem and Semmi came into the barber shop?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cuba Gooding, Jr.

questions.question: Which collective noun refers to a group of gorillas?
Quails and swans live in groups, referred to as what?
Who sang 1970s top ten hit,  Baby, Im a Want You?
A group of geese is called both a gaggle and a skein.
In the movie Coming to America, Lisas father Cleo (played by John Amos) owned a restaurant which was very similar to this hugely popular restaurant franchise.
What collective noun can be used as a synonym of troup, which means a group of kangaroos?

In the movie Coming to America, Akeem first sees his future bride at a Black Awareness Rally.  At this rally, Randy Watson (played by Eddie Murphy) and his band provided a special rendition of Whitney Houstons Greatest Love of All. What was the name of Randy Watsons band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sexual Chocolate

questions.question: In the film Coming to America, what was the name of Clarences barber shop where Clarence and his friends would discuss great boxing legends?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My-T Sharp

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Group and Beer
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, country, stout. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Dr. Hawkeye Pierce was given his nickname by his father. Where did his father get the name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Book

questions.question: This country has the highest number of breweries in the world, and beer plays a significant part of its culture. Among the numerous famous brands it produces are Krombacher, Warsteiner and Bitburger.
Which collective noun refers to a group of cats?
Which collective noun means a group of bees?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In the popular TV series M*A*S*H, what color is Dr. Hawkeye Pierces favorite bathrobe?
Which word means a group of whales or seals?
Which noun means a group of swine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: Where did Dr. Hawkeye Pierce attend medical school according to M*A*S*H?
What is Hawkeyes beverage of choice in M*A*S*H?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Homemade Gin Martinis

questions.question: Crows live in a group called a murder.
This dark stout beer was first brewed in 1759 at St. Jamess Gate Brewery, Dublin, Ireland.  One of its varieties is Foreign Extra Stout Nigeria, which is brewed using sorghum instead of barley.
It is stated in ancient texts that the earliest beers are Sumerian. Name the ancient Sumerian goddess of beer, daughter of  Enki.
Dr. Hawkeye Pierce from M*A*S*H* is married in the TV series.
According to the classic tv show M*A*S*H, what state was the character Hawkeye” originally from?
Elk live in a group called what?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Beer and Germany
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, leader, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This beer brand, which is a German language adjective for something from the city of České Budějoviceis, is often advertised as the King of Beers’.
Name the phase in beer brewing in which the malted grains are crushed and soaked in warm water, as a result of which, enzymes turn starches into fermentable sugars.
Which country did Germany invade on September 1, 1939?
One of the most famous events in Munich, Germany is this two-week annual festival. It begins with a keg of beer tapped by the Mayor of Munich.

One of the causes of World War II was this treaty, which officially ended World War I and forced Germany to accept full responsibility for the war, pay reparations and forfeit all its overseas and African colonies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Treaty of Versailles

questions.question: How did Adolf Hitler, the leader of  Nazi Germany from 1934 to 1945, die?

options.text: He died of natural causes In Soviet captivity
He died of heart attack when the Soviets reached the Reichstag

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He committed suicide

questions.question: Efes Beverage Group, founded in 1969 and named after an ancient city, is the major beer producer in this country.

The treaty of non-aggression signed between Germany and the Soviet Union a few months before the start of WW II was violated when Germany invaded the USSR. The operation of the German invasion was named what?

Name the movie in which Vincent said the following words: Well, in Amsterdam, you can buy beer in a movie theatre. And I dont mean in a paper cup either. They give you a glass of beer, like in a bar. In Paris, you can buy beer at MacDonalds.
This country is famous for its lager beers, especially Amstel, Heineken and Grolsch.
Which of these countries managed to stay neutral throughout the Second World War?
Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy. The words were delivered by this philosopher, inventor, politician and economist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benjamin Franklin

questions.question: During WW II, the German name Auschwitz was given to what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A concentration camp

questions.question: What was the name of the ballistic missile weapon first used in the Second World War?
An estimated 62 million people lost their lives during World War II.  Which country gave the most casualties?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Soviet Union

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Signs and Symbol
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, leopards, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The symbol of the astrological sign Libra is the bull.
The archer is the symbol of which of these signs?
How long did a man named Charles Osborne hiccup continuously?
In 2001, St. Patricks Day celebration went on as planned in Ireland.
Pound for pound, leopards are considered to be seven times stronger than humans.
From the year 1945, when the United Nations was founded to 2006 there were over 200 wars.
Aerosmiths Dude Looks Like a Lady was written about Vince Neil of Motley Crue.
Taurus, Virgo and Capricorn are astrological signs that fall under what element?
During the Battle of Stalingrad, Hitler made a desperate attempt to deter his forces from surrendering. What did he do?

options.text: Issued an order anyone who surrendered to be shot
Threatened the general in charge with execution of his family

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Promoted the general in charge

questions.question: A person born on December 23 is on the cusp of which 2 signs?
People born under the astrological sign Gemini have a birthday between May 21 and June 21.
The astrological signs Cancer, Pisces and Scorpio are associated with the element Air.
United States declared war on Japan following the attack on Pearl Harbor. What was President Franklin Roosevelt’s pretext to enter the European theater?

options.text: Germanys threats on the United Kingdom
The German declaration of war on the United States
The German invasion of the Soviet Union

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The German declaration of war on the United States

questions.question: What is a persons astrological sign if he/she was born between August 23 and September 22?
Which of the following is among the variety of jobs actor Sylvester Stallone had, before becoming an actor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a lion cage cleaner

questions.question: This character, who was first featured in a 1976 Academy Award-winning movie, was portrayed by Sylvester Stallone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rocky Balboa

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Merchant of Venice

Does any creature have the ability to change its sex?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sultan of Swat

questions.question: A piece of French toast that was partially eaten by Justin Timberlake sold on eBay for over 3000 US dollars.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marilyn Monroe

questions.question: Once more unto the breach dear friends, once more!  This line is from the final play of a historical tetralogy by Shakespeare. Name the play.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Henry V

questions.question: Jumping spiders, which represent the largest family of spiders, are superior to most other spiders in which of the following ways?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They have better vision

questions.question: Who is Fred Flintstones boss at the Slate Rock and Gravel Company?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mr. Slate

questions.question: This US state is famous for Lake Okeechobee, the fourth largest lake completely within the United States.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Drew Barrymore
